fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-43174].
  {panel}

When creating an issue on most pages in JIRA, if you close the browser or tab during the creation you get a popup saying "Do you want to stay on this page or leave", basically confirming that you want to discard your changes to the form on the page.

When viewing an Agile Board, however, when creating an issue (by clicking the Create button along the top), you can close the tab/window without the confirmation popping up. This makes it so users can lose their work while creating issues.

Many of our users sit on their Agile board view most of the time, thus making it likely for this event to occur and cause users to lose work.

This is using JIRA server 6.3.4 and JIRA Agile 6.6.80
fields.summary: Creating an issue while on an Agile Board doesn't catch closing tab/window

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-43171].
{panel}
{panel:title=Status Update|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ff7f7f|titleBGColor=#ff7f7f|bgColor=#e5e5e5}
Oauth 2 is already available for Jira Core and Jira Service Desk REST API endpoints:
 - [https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/oauth-2-authorization-code-grants-3lo-for-apps/]
 - [https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/service-desk/oauth-2-authorization-code-grants-3lo-for-apps/]

And for a subset of the endpoints available for Jira Software Cloud:
 - [https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/software/integrate-jsw-cloud-with-onpremises-tools/]

The feature request to have also the other endpoints supported is: JSWCLOUD-18874

You can see whether Oauth2 is supported or not for an endpoint by checking if the documentation is mentioning:
{quote}OAuth scopes required: XXXXX
{quote}{panel}
Customers would like to see the option or ability to include OAuth 2.0 support when using integrations with JIRA and other third party applications.
fields.summary: OAuth 2.0 Support

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-43170].
  {panel}

I would like to add a multi-select custom field to my issues where the options link to a confluence page.

The particular case I would use it, is to associate an issue with one or more 'Personas'. Each of those can be described on a confluence page with a special 'persona' tag.

In edit mode, the field should provide the user a choice of confluence pages matching a certain query (in my case, all pages with the 'persona' tag). In view mode, the user should be able to click-through to the confluence page.

This should faciliate creating the link as
- the link can now be added (through the custom field) while Creating the issue
- The user does not have to go through the process of searching through all confluence pages, as only the limited set of pages matching a query is presented.

Something more static used to be possible with multi-select fields and HTML-coded links, but this has been disabled, as HTML is now escaped. 

JRA-6762 describes a similar issue, but this solution is also no longer available.
fields.summary: Custom Field pointing to one or more Confluence Pages

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-43168].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
User can add extra log work even when the Remaining Time is 0.

h3. Suggested Solution
JIRA should has an option to block any user/group to add extra *log work* in *time spent* when the *Remaining Time* is already with the 0 value.

h3. Workaround
Time Sheet plugin by default, does not allow the user to add extra log work when the Remaining time is 0, so you can use it as a workaround.
!Screen Shot 2015-04-29 at 4.01.25 PM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: JIRA shouldn't allow users to add extra log work in time spent when Remaining Time is 0

To have JIRA to prompt out confirmation screen whenever in the process of editing the field's value in "View Screen"
* new values entered and confirmation for new values

* accidentally closing or navigating away from jira.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-43139].
  {panel}

In current version it's not possible to enforce strong password policy in JIRA.

Steps:
1. Enter Password Policy screen (System -> Security -> Password Policy).
2. Try to set Password Length to any value higher than 32.

Current result:
- error message {{The new password policy configuration could not be applied. Please correct the errors below and try again.}} (x),
- hint near Minimum Length field: {{Please use a value from 0 to 32. Using either 0 or 1 effectively disables the minimum length.}} (x).

Expected result:
- it should be possible to enforce strong password policies: maximum value for Minimum Length should be equal to maximum value of Maximum Length.
fields.summary: Should be able to use larger values for the minimum password length

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-43138].
  {panel}

h3.Summary
Right now when changing a project key; the old project key is still stored in the database and registered under the same project. This prevents other projects from using the old project key as the key is still being occupied by other projects. All records of the project key should be removed so that other projects can use this specific key.

h3.Workaround
For now users will have to remove the project entirely so that the records of all the project keys under the project will be removed. While this works for newly created projects; this is obviously not suitable workaround if the project already contains a lot of issues.
fields.summary: Projects should not store old project keys after they are changed

Steps to reproduce:

2. In the share dialog, enter an email address which contains an apostrophe.

The email address should be accepted.

Actual Result:
JIRA complains that the email address is invalid.

Note that while creating a user, JIRA accepts an email address with apostrophe.

UserListSuggestHandler should allow apostrophe in email

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-43131].
  {panel}

JIRA supports permission control for gadgets by looking for a "roles-required" param in the gadget definition in atlassian-plugin.xml. This is used, for example, to hide certain gadgets from anonymous users when they look at the dashboard.

For example:
{code}
<gadget key="admin-gadget" name="Administration" location="gadgets/admin-gadget.xml">
    <param name="roles-required">admin</param>
    <resource type="download" name="admin-screenshot.png" location="images/admin-screenshot.png"/>
    <resource type="download" name="admin-thumb.png" location="images/admin-thumb.png"/>
</gadget>

<gadget key="road-map-gadget" name="Road Map Gadget" location="gadgets/roadmap-gadget.xml">
    <param name="roles-required">browse</param>
    <resource type="download" name="roadmap-screenshot.png" location="images/roadmap-screenshot.png"/>
    <resource type="download" name="roadmap-thumb.png" location="images/roadmap-thumb.png"/>
</gadget>
{code}
It looks like the wallboard plugin is trying to render these gadgets for everyone, resulting in an error.
fields.summary: When viewing a wallboard as an anonymous user, gadgets that I don't have permission to see display an error

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-43109].
  {panel}

Currently, a project can only be linked to an email address when setting up its notifications. Following on, JIRA still uses the email account setup as an "outgoing mail server" to actually send the emails.

This causes problems such as the ones outlined at JRA-34817. 

A mismatch between the email address and the actual account to be used to send emails is treated by some public email services as an spoofing attempt and therefore, the mails continue to be sent from the address linked to the outgoing mail account rather than the one configured for the project.

Under JRA-34817 we added a warning for this situation as a short-term fix. 

To completely avoid this problem, the outgoing mail functionality needs to be rewritten such that a user is able to add several "outgoing mail servers" (email accounts) and then be able to link a project to a full account rather than just an email address.
fields.summary: Support for full mail accounts to be linked to a Project via its Notification Scheme

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-43105].
  {panel}

h2. Background
In support of our common Agile (weekly) release workflow, we affix a "fixVersion" to any jira ticket branch merged to our common {{develop}} branch. To facilitate effective, manual regression testing (our system tests already completed on {{develop}} as a nightly process), we branch weekly from {{develop}} (Release-YYYYMMDD) and release weekly. Any test fail is either reverted, fixed, temporarily tolerated for immediate follow-up "next-day" fix, release-noted, or rolled back to last "clean" label on develop (last option... "baby with the bathwater"). Lastly, if changes are currently passing manual regression, we release to master on release day (all tickets transitioned to {{released}} state)

h2. The Problem: "Automatability" of Setting "fix version"
We want to leverage Jira and Stash to do a couple of things:
# After each pull request merge, we want to affix a (new or existing) "fix version" to the tickets being merged to {{develop}}. We've installed [JJupin|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.keplerrominfo.jira.plugins.jjupin] but the "destination branch" in the Jira automated transition is not visible to our post function. The transition logic is as follows: "If a pull request is merged and the destination branch is {{develop} then add "YYYYMMDD" (the "develop" scheduled release date) fix version to the ticket.
# When a pull request is reverted (please implement STASH-3218?), remove any YYYYMMDD fix version from the ticket and reopen the jira ticket.

h2. What we need?
# Add more "pull request" data to the automated Jira transitions triggered by stash PRs such as "source branch", "destination branch" etc and make them visible to Jira post function actions. Greater PR data visibility allows for better, more customized decisions in the jira ticket workflow.
fields.summary: Automatic transitions triggered by Stash should allow more advanced conditions and actions

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-43095].
  {panel}

When configuring POP/IMAP accounts within JIRA for Incoming / Outgoing email, JIRA only allows for the use of POP / IMAP email accounts e.g., Google email. Customers would like the ability to use a Google group as well. Several other issue tracking systems allow for this.

*Current behavior*
When selecting the type of email account, only POP / IMAP accounts are available in the drop down list
These accounts require a username / password

*Requested behavior*
When selecting the type of email account, POP / IMAP / Group accounts are displayed. The list would populate based on the Google Apps account being used with the JIRA instance.
fields.summary: Allow the use of Google Groups for sending / receiving email within JIRA

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-43094].
  {panel}

Currently when you delete a permission scheme within JIRA, there is no backup / copy made of the permission scheme. It is simply removed from JIRA. If JIRA would make a backup / copy of the permission scheme being deleted, this would help Administrators in recovering / rolling back changes. This would work the same way JIRA makes a copy of a Workflow.

*Current behavior*
Click Delete for permission scheme
JIRA asks if you really want to delete the permission scheme
Click Delete to confirm
Permission scheme is deleted

*Requested behavior*
Click Delete for permission scheme
JIRA asks if you really want to delete the permission scheme
JIRA indicates that a copy of the permissions scheme will be created
Click Delete to confirm
Permission scheme is deleted
Copy of permission scheme shows up under 'Inactive Permission Schemes' popup
fields.summary: Have JIRA create a backup / copy of permission schemes upon deletion
Suggest a local admin in "Connecting JIRA to an LDAP" documentation

h4. Summary
When you mention a user in the comment, existing participant will only get *Issue Commented* notification, but no *Mentioned* notification

h4. Environment
* JIRA 6.4.2
* Gmail

h4. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an issue with *User 1*
# Set *User 1* to be the assignee as well
# Have *User 2* mention *User 1* in the comment

h4. Actual Results
Only *Issue Commented* notification email received by *User 1*. Only if you are not the collaborator of this issue, then you will receive the *Mentioned* notification email.

h4. Expected Results
# Combine *Issue Commented* & *Mentioned* notification into the same email. Eq. *User 2* commented and mentioned you on JIRA-1. OR
# Update [Emailing an issue to users by mentioning them|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Emailing+an+Issue#EmailinganIssue-mentions] documentation, which stated something like: _If you are already a collaborator in an issue, you won't get the mentioned notification_.
fields.summary: Persist mention notification even when user is already a participant of an issue

fields.description:
h3. Summary
JIRA WebHooks are not using the {{-Dhttp.nonProxyHosts}} configuration. This means that JIRA Web Hooks are using the proxy. 

This affects JIRA 6.4.2. 

h3. Environment
- JIRA 6.4.2
- Using JIRA with a HTTP Proxy Server

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Attempt to use a WebHook, while bypassing the proxy
# Observe the Proxy still gets requests from the JIRA Server
# Only by completely removing the JIRA Proxy configurations can you avoid communicating with the Proxy Server.

h3. Expected Results
# JIRA WebHooks should respect the nonProxyHosts argument so that External sites that can not be accessed via the proxy can be reached.
# Any Hostname listed in the nonProxyHosts should not be accessed by a Proxy Server.

h3. Actual Results
# JIRA communicates via a Proxy to hosts listed in the nonProxyHosts argument when using Web Hooks.

h3. Notes
This is duplicated by: [JRA-43143|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-43143] Please use that issue. 

h3. Workaround

No reasonable workaround to this issue, other than avoid using a Proxy Server with JIRA if WebHooks are being used.
fields.summary: Webhook doesn't respect -Dhttp.nonProxyHosts
Better / nicer / HD emoticons

h3. Summary

If multiple services exist for the same class (such as Subversion indexing) in JIRA, the startup logs will not output this.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Install multiples of the same service in JIRA. It is not currently known how to reproduce this, however has been reported on bugs such as [SVN-452|https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/SVN-452].
# Restart JIRA.

h3. Expected Results

The "Services" block displays multiple Subversion services.

h3. Actual Results

The "Services" block only displays one instance of that service, for example:

{noformat}
___ Services _______________________________

     Instance Count                                : 2

     Subversion Index Update Service               : com.atlassian.jira.plugin.ext.subversion.revisions.scheduling.clustersafe.UpdateSvnIndexService
          Service Delay                                 : 3600000ms
     Subversion Revision Indexing Service          : com.atlassian.jira.plugin.ext.subversion.revisions.RevisionIndexService
          Service Delay                                 : 300000ms
{noformat}

h3. Notes

There should not be multiple services installed with the same class in the first place - however if this does happen they can be removed as per [Services|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Services].
fields.summary: JIRA startup does not list multiple instances of the same service

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-43077].
  {panel}

h3. Problem
"Add gadget" window doesn't display all gadgets available for an instance of JIRA.
There is no *"Load all Gadgets"* option in the dialog after 60 seconds.

h3. Actual behavior
Window displays no gadgets or very few. A warning message appears when loading contents for the "Add gadget" window.
{quote}
Failed to load gadgets

Something went wrong while trying to load the gadgets.

Try Again
{quote}

JIRA logs:
{noformat}
2015-03-10 10:00:15.749629500 2015-03-10 10:00:15,712 DirectoryEntryResolverThread-7 WARN sysadmin 807x25311x1 1o8lylz 209.203.106.30,165.254.226.146 /rest/config/1.0/directoryitems/local.json [renderer.internal.local.LocalGadgetSpecFactory$Parser] Could not retrieve gadget spec https://site.atlassian.net/rest/gadgets/1.0/g/com.atlassian.jira.gadgets:favourite-filters-gadget/gadgets/favourite-filters-gadget.xml from plugin-provided gadget spec store: null
{noformat}

h3. Notes
The operation takes a long time, and consumes excessive CPU resources.
This puts pressure on the whole instance, and is affected by other users that may be attempting to load other JIRA screens. 
In some cases it finishes loading after 50 seconds but after 60 it will timeout and display the error message.

h3. Steps to reproduce: 
On affected instances, try to "Add Gadget" in a New Dashboard.
First the message will show:
 !not all gadgets loaded.png|thumbnail! 
and after 60 seconds:
 !some-gadgets-failed-to-load.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
* Perform the operation again when the site is not being heavily used. A link to "Load all gadgets" should appear in less than 60 seconds and will show the gadgets on later attempts to add gadgets to the same dashboard.
* Restarting JIRA may also help temporarily.
fields.summary: Gadgets missing from "Add gadget" window

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-43075].
  {panel}

I am writing an Atlassian Connect addon and I want to be able to say things like:

* Who are all of the users that have PROJECT_ADMIN in this project?
* Does this user have the permissions that they need?

This seems to be the only permission url that I can find that will do the job and it seems to be completely buggy.

* It returns 401's when I think it means 403's.
* If I don't provide a username filter then, instead of not filtering at all (like the docs suggest), it returns the error message "The username query parameter was not provided".
* The URL does not seem to obey permission checks correctly. When my user had PROJECT_ADMIN then it returned no results, but when I gave that user ADMIN then I started getting 401 errors back.

All in all this rest resource is currently completely unuseable.

And, to make matters worse, when I looked at the JIRA code then I saw that there is not one single test in com.atlassian.jira.rest.v2.issue.UserResourceTest that excercises this rest call.

The bottom line is this:

* This is a critical REST call that must work for Atlassian Connect addons.
* It is completely untested and that needs to be rectified immediately and the tests need to be extensive.
* There are permission and functionality issues this this rest resource that need immediate attention.

Please put this at the top of the backlog or somewhere high. Cheers.
fields.summary: rest/api/2/user/permission/search is broken in many different ways.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-43068].
  {panel}

h3. Problem

Using a webhook triggered from a transition returns incomplete data specifically the {{to_status)) returns null. 

h3. Reason

The {{transition}} object that is being returned in the JSON contains the {{from_status}} and {{to_status}} attributes. From testing with a fresh workflow, and testing with your workflow, you'll notice that in the JSON object, {{from_status}} is always being returned correctly (even if it's {{null}} in the descriptor), whereas {{to_status}} is always returning the value of {{status}} from the workflow descriptor XML. This is apparent when examining the code in the jira-webhooks-plugin that populates the values for the JSON. The
{{to_status}} is always going to be the status of the {{createdStep}}, which is populated from the database. Whereas {{from_status}} is actually being looked up in the jira workflow.

h3. Workaround

Export the XML of the workflow that you want to use the webhooks on, edit the {{status}} manually to something that makes sense, import the edited workflow, and continue to use the webhooks. You should only need to edit the {{status}} as it's the only attribute not being return correctly in the webhooks.
fields.summary: to_status in the JSON is null when using Webhooks

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-43044].
  {panel}

We are using the JIRA workflow triggers with Bitbucket (Git), and are having issues where a commit message contains multiple JIRA issue keys.

*Actual*
Currently, all issues keys in the commit message are triggered on. This can cause issues when issues are incidentally mentioned and and not intended to be triggered. 
E.g. A commit message of "ABC-111 - Fixed the foo, bar still broken and logged in ABC-222" will trigger on both ABC-111 and ABC-222. However, the developer has not intended to trigger ABC-222.

*Expected*
I would like to see the option of enforcing that issue keys must be front-loaded in the commit comment. 
E.g. To trigger two issues and not trigger the third, use the comment "ABC-111 ABC-222 - Fixed foo and bar, outstanding work required on ABC-333"
fields.summary: Workflow Triggers: Add option to force front-loading of issue keys

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-43038].
  {panel}

h3.Summary:
Following the Process outlined here:
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/Configuring+Issue-level+Security

When Applying an Issue Security Scheme to a project >400-500 issues causes a timeout to occur, and displays a blank screen eventually leading to a XRSF missing security token page.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Apply Issue level security to a large project containg ~>400 issues

h3.Expected
Operation completes successfully

h3.Actual
After ~60 seconds the page will timeout

If One of the following functions is initiated it can cause Other Errors to occur and the Instance Stops the progress of the Bulk operation and will leave some issues assigned to the scheme and others are not:
- the Page is Refreshed before the XRSF token Error
- Re-index is run
- Attempt to run a second issue security association to the project

The above operations can lead to locking out all users From accessing the Tickets additional steps are needed if this occurs there are additional steps needed to fix detailed in this Knowledge-Base Article
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Issue+Security+Levels+Locks+Issues+From+All+Users

h2.Workaround:
1. open two tabs first tab issue security for the project and the other issue navigator with the Query {{project = <DESIRED_PROJECT> AND level is EMPTY}}
2. Apply a Issue Security Scheme that causes a timeout at 60 seconds
DO NOT RUN ANY OF THESE OPERATIONS until it completes the bulk assignment:
- Running a re-index
- Reloading the page after the timeout occurs
- Attempting to run a new issue security association.

3. Even though the timeout occurs in the UI the operation continues in the background
- to track the progress use following JQL query In Issue Navigator after adding the security column to the issue navigator view.  (Note that the security level is noted by the JQL {{LEVEL}}):
{code}
project = <Desired Project> AND level is EMPTY
{code}

4. once it no longer reruns results the operation is complete.
- You can also run the following to confirm all issues associated properly:
{{project = <Desired Project> AND level is not EMPTY}}

5. When it completes run a full lock and re-index of the system to clear out all erroneous caching caused by the timeout. as the association will only display 50% of the time in the Issue security scheme unless the index is rebuilt.
fields.summary: Issue Security Timeout on large Projects

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-43036].
  {panel}

If the Instance has been configured *not* to allow unassigned issues, and the Project Lead has been set as the Default Assignee, then the Issue Collector will still not allow you to create a new one.

The Following Error is shown:
{quote}
Error

You cannot create an issue collector for this project, because the following fields are required on the project and those field types cannot be displayed to anonymous users. If the field is changed to be optional or a default value is provided, then an Issue Collector can be created for the project. Not allowed fields: Assignee
{quote}

The Issue Collector should default back to the Automatic (Project Lead) User if the instance has been configured in this way.

*Steps to Reproduce*
# Go to _General Configuration_ and set *Allow unassigned Issues* to *Off*
# Create a new project and make the _Project Lead_ the default Assignee
# Go to Project Administration > Issue Collectors > Add Issue Collector
# Try to create a new Issue Collector, the above error is thrown.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-43031].
  {panel}

When we're attempting to use the jira-api jar in maven via

{{<dependency>
      <groupId>com.atlassian.jira</groupId>
      <artifactId>jira-api</artifactId>
      <version>6.4.2</version>
      <scope>provided</scope>
</dependency>}}

We get the error:

{{org.eclipse.aether.transfer.ArtifactNotFoundException: Failure to find jta:jta:jar:1.0.1}}

Which is a dependency that is pulled in from https://maven.atlassian.com/content/groups/public/com/atlassian/jira/jira-project/6.4.2/jira-project-6.4.2.pom 

It looks like jta version 1.0.1 has been removed from all of the public maven repositories.  Can you update this dependency in jira-project to be jta version 1.0.1B which is available on your maven repository at https://maven.atlassian.com/content/groups/public/jta/jta/1.0.1B/jta-1.0.1B.pom

Or just fix the dependency relocation altogether so the dependency is 

<groupId>javax.transaction</groupId>
<artifactId>jta</artifactId>
<version>1.0.1B</version>

which is available on mvn central. 

Related issues/answers:
https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/106630/missing-resources-jndi-and-jta-atlas-run
https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/68542/building-jira-5-1-from-source-build-error
fields.summary: Update jta dependency in jira-project pom.xml to a version that is available on public maven repositories
Update Retrieving the JIRA Administrator documentation

  {panel}

*Steps to reproduce:*
# Go to _General Configuration_ and set *Allow unassigned issues* setting to *Off*. The _Assignee_ field will be automatically set to _Required_ in the Field Configuration. 
# Create a new project and make the _Project Lead_ as the _Default Assignee_
# Go to _Project Administration -> Issue Collectors -> Add Issue Collector_
# Key in all the required field and click _Submit_

*Current Result:*
- The page is refreshed and returns to the same page without any error message shown until the users change the _Issue Type_

*Expected Result:*
- The error message should be displayed without changing the _Issue Type_
{noformat}
Error

You cannot create an issue collector for this project, because the following fields are required on the project and those field types cannot be displayed to anonymous users. If the field is changed to be optional or a default value is provided, then an Issue Collector can be created for the project. Not allowed fields: Assignee
{noformat}

*Workaround:*
- Set *Allow unassigned issues* setting to *On* in General Configuration

  {panel}

h3. Summary

Since JIRA 6.4.1/ 6.5-OD-01, PDFs attachments are not displayed inline in the user's browser. Instead, users are prompted to download the file and open it locally.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Attach a PDF file to a JIRA Issue
h3. Expected Results

The PDF file is displayed in the user's browser.
h3. Actual Results

The user is prompted to download the file.

 
h3. Workaround

User may upgrade to JIRA 7. JIRA 7 provide the feature to preview pdf file.
fields.summary: Unable to Open PDFs Inline - Prompted for Download

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-43011].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Ideally we would like the ability to prevent time tracking and logging work on our parent issue and have all done at the subtask level. 

h3. Suggested Solution

Seems like Splitting the Time Tracking permissions in the Permission scheme could accomplish this for us. 

Having the ability to add or remove log work on issues should be separate in project and issue level, for example like this: 
* Ability to Add Log Work on Parent Issues 
* Ability to Add Log Work on Subtask Issues. 
* Ability to Remove Log Work on Parent Issues 
* Ability to Remove Log Work on Subtask Issues.
fields.summary: Split the permission scheme for time tracking
configure release date as mandatory while adding versions to project
